channel.title: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice
channel.description:
How do make it so ::pure banneds players who abuse it more then once? And i also have a problem with Fightpits. i made it so theres only Follow,Walkhere,and trade option and it effected by Fightpits. So i can't attack people in there. ):
Please help.

item.title: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice

@t_o_m wrote:

Sorry if i’m causing any inconvenience or annoying you, i’m just confused,
Thanks for taking the time you help me,
could you show me how this should look?
I must be doing something wrong.

Read full topic

item.source: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice

item.title: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

This is a simple error. You are calling for a method that does not exist.

If you think you will want to do other bans like this then i suggest creating the method. The method will look something like this:

public boolean appendBanned() { writeLog(p.playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; return true; }

That will write the character name in the bans file. It will also disconnect them.

If you do not think you will be using more bans of this sort i suggest replacing appendBanned(); with writeLog(p.playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true;

Read full topic
item.source: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice

client.java:8111: cannot find symbol symbol : method appendBanned() location: class client appendBanned(); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Now this error comes out.
I’m not understanding the problem at all…

Read full topic
item.source: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice

item.title: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

Ok, i found the problem.

It is saying ‘else’ without ‘if’ because our else statement is placed outside the brackets in which the if statement is located in.

Change it to this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { int pure = 0; for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) { if (i != 1 && i!= 5 && pure <= 5) addSkillXP(15000000, i); else { appendBanned(); disconnected = true; } } }

Read full topic

Edit:
took Else out, and got this error

client.java:8623: illegal start of expression public void debug(String text) { ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.source: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice

item.title: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

To make ::pure banned after a certain time.

first declare this.

public int pure = 0;

That will keep count of the amount of times the pure command is used.

change your pure command to this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && pure <= 5) { for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) { if (i != 1 && i!= 5) addSkillXP(15000000, i); } else if (pure > 5) { appendBanned(); disconnect = true; }

Now ::pure can only be done if the player has not done ::pure 5 times. If the player has done it 5 times then they will be banned and disconnected.

EDIT: If the above does not work try this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { int pure = 0; for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) { if (i != 1 && i!= 5 && pure <= 5) addSkillXP(15000000, i); } else { appendBanned(); disconnected = true; }

Read full topic
item.source: How do i Fix ::pure on Delta so it bans if used twice
